title: Calories in a Scrambled Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in a scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), scrambled in 1 tsp butter, no added milk, salt, or other ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, cooking method, and seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One scrambled large egg has ~91 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 slice cheddar cheese per egg

faqs.q: How many calories in a scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg cooked in 1 tsp butter.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.3 g protein per large scrambled egg.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~7.1 g total fat, mostly from the egg yolk and added butter.

faqs.q: How does scrambling affect calories compared to boiled?
faqs.a: Scrambled adds calories from cooking fat; boiled is ~78 kcal without additions.

faqs.q: Can I make scrambled eggs lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, skip butter and use a nonstick pan to reduce to ~55 kcal.
